website_summaries.verdict: A split anchor design lets you change resistance more easily and take your workout to the next level.
pros: This kit's split anchor design lets you create wider angles for greater resistance
Allows you to work more muscle groups
Great for rehab because it is so low-impact
cons: Cam buckles have been known to slip and release under pressure

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: This product page shows images, questions, and reviews for a different product than the one that was delivered. Do not buy from here. The product that I received did not have foot straps and did not mount from two separate points. The door hooks did not match the image either. Complete bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Tilted handle messes with the grip
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a really sturdy piece of equipment, but out of the box, one handle is completely tilted which messes with your grip and hand positioning. It's a manufacturer error, and since the webbing where the handle is joined to the rest of the strap is joined sewn, there's no adjusting it. I'm hoping the manufacturer contacts me--I'd love to exchange the piece and get it right, because otherwise this looks like a great addition to the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: This is not Lifeline jungle gym XLT as title suggests
customer_reviews.text: This is not Lifeline jungle gym XLT as title suggest. It is an older model. All the positive reviews were made for the XLT version , not this version. Also, I received one that has been clearly used since the handle has numerous markings on it. There is no contact seller information as well to address these complaints. Very misleading
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mislabeled Product: This is not the Jungle Gym XT
customer_reviews.text: I thought the $50 price was a bit suspicious but I purchased anyway. I was not shipped the Jungle Gym XT and instead received a much cheaper feeling and different model apparently from Lifeline. I use the Jungle Gym XT at my local gym. The one you receive is the one in the product picture and not from user reviews photos. Not sure what is going on with the missmatch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not So Easy As It Looks
customer_reviews.text: I watched the Youtube instructional videos for this product and the models make the exercises look so easy. Because of the added core instability even a simple exercise like a push up can become very challenging. I have these suspended from a chin up bar in one of my doorways. Very convenient. Quickly and easily adjust to different lengths and even someone recovering from surgery or who is just very deconditioned can use these to assist them through a basic routine. On the other hand, you can also do some very demanding advanced routines. Well made, grips and stirrups are comfortable. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It's great, but there are better options out there...
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these hang single or double in a door or on a hanging point. I love the handles & stirrups and how comfortable they feel plus they are easy to clean. But, I just can't get over how irritating the extra strap length is (the red sliding flaps do NOT hold them out of the way). It's also VERY challenging to get the lengths even without lying them out, measuring & marking with a paint marker. Bummed they aren't more user friendly as they could be exceptional with a few tweaks! Check out FitIndex for a good option in a similar price range.
customer_reviews.author: WASK

customer_reviews.title: Less expensive and just as good as TRX.
customer_reviews.text: This suspension trainer is great. The one outstanding feature are the foot cradles. Very easy to get in and out of in comparison with the TRX. Another great feature is the ability to place the straps at different distances from each other. This eliminates strap interference on shoulders and arms when doing upper body exercises. It also mimics the TRX single point anchoring system simply by placing the straps next to each other resulting in decreased stability thereby challenging your core strength. All this and approximately $120 cheaper than the TRX Pro 4 (also owned).
customer_reviews.author: Bill McMilleon

customer_reviews.title: I don’t think this is lifeline
customer_reviews.text: I received this but it does not match the reviews. It is not dual anchor only one. It came in a plastic bag with a color handout on how to set up. No dvd or exercise chart. The product is not branded. I went to the Escalade website and this config is not listed. It works so will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: Overall the best suspension trainer out there
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used several different styles of suspension trainers. They are all great, but if I had to pick one...it would be the Lifeline Jungle Gym. The split anchor design allows you to mount it pretty much anywhere and the foot cradle design is superior compared to other products I have used. A good suspension trainer is probably one of the best investments you can make for a home gym. Thanks for a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Not jungle gym suspension product from lifeline
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item thinking that it was a jungle gym suspension training equipment from Lifeline. Wrong! It’s a total knock off. Do NOT Purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Teekay

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and great home workout
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for strength training at home while I can't go to the gym. I secured it in a ceiling beam. When not in use, the ceiling hook is used for a suspended chair for my kids. It is easier and faster for me to make length adjustments with this even though the straps are independent than it was for me to do the same with the TRX my local gym has.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Bennett

customer_reviews.title: These are great, same thing as the other strap brand but ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, same thing as the other strap brand but for a fraction of the price. I'd suggest buying their hangers and putting them on the wall. I put them on the ceiling and they make the workout so intense, I feel like a beginner. But I view that as a great thing because it's really helped spruce up my home gym options. The handles are fairly easy on the hands, which is nice. I think they've got some silicone covering on them that's grippy but not rough. The length on the straps is more than adequate, I'd think with a 10' ceiling the straps would still allow room for pushups even.
customer_reviews.author: 17keos

customer_reviews.title: Buy this instead of TRX!
customer_reviews.text: I also have Lifeline Resistance bands, and they have exceeded my expectations. It seems that Lifeline products are sturdier than the competition. I compared this Jungle Gym to the TRX version of the same at my gym on post. Both work fine, but this Lifeline is less than half the price of the TRX. I also like the moulded handles better than the loose woven handles found on the TRX version. I used it tonight inside the gym, attached to a pull-up bar. I also used it outside, connected to a handrail off the side of stairs. This kit has all that you will need to attach almost anywhere, even inside your hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: Man

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability. Otherwise works as described.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using for 3-4 months now. Work out 3-4 times a week. Works great/as described. But I don’t remember it being $99. Supply and demand I guess. One negative thing to note is it’s durability. Both straps at the anchor size are folded over and sewn together so theoretically twice as strong. However the strap has torn by the area where door (maybe user error?) is in contact with. Probably only have maybe one more month left in it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Miranda

customer_reviews.title: NOTICE THE PRODUCT YOU GET IS NOT THE SAME AS THE ONE MENTIONED IN THE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: I RECEIVED A PRODUCT THAT LOOKS LIKE THE PROTOTYPE VERSION OF THE JUNGLE GYM XT. CHEAP QUALITY IN THE HANDLES AND ZERO INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO SETUP THE HANDLES. I CANT BELIEVE THIS IS WAS A DIRECT AMAZON PURCHASE. SEEMS MORE LIKE I RECEIVED SOMETHING FROM A SKETCHY VENDOR.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Just like TRX
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used TRX before and these straps are just as good, if not better. Super easy to adjust the length and the foot loops are way better than what TRX uses. I’ve had no issues with the clasps giving out and the adjustments changing on their own like other reviews have said.
customer_reviews.author: Joss

customer_reviews.title: Really bad quality. You can tell it’s garbage the second you open the package
customer_reviews.text: Quality on this thing is really bad. Feels like garbage you would get from the dollar store. Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but handle can be dissasembled too easily.
customer_reviews.text: Removing 1 star because the handle detaches from the sides. I havent had accidents yet, but i'm always afraid the handle will pop off and i'll fall. Otherwise, the material is ultra sturdy and will do the job. I got this for 60 bucks during black friday. UPDATE: After 2 years of light use, they are still OK. Two details: - The handle can detach, use gorilla glue and/or heavy tape to keep it sturdy. - After adjusting the strap, you end up with it dangling everywhere. Use a piece of rubber band or bungee cord to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rummy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Other products might do the job, but the price point here made the difference for me. I weigh about 230 and have had no issues with the locks slipping. The straps are sturdy enough to support me and I have had some great work outs on it so far. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Overall it works great, only issue I have encountered is the red ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works great, only issue I have encountered is the red silicone sliding piece to help take up the slack on one of the straps does not hold its position and I end up with a lot of extra strap hanging right by the handle. Anybody else have this issue? I would give 5 star rating if not for this problem
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Well-built quality product.  Tricky to learn to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is well built and feels secure using only the door anchors. However, because it requires a door that opens away from you, I end up exercising in my hallway, which is less than ideal. The wall anchors seem to be an expensive add-on given what I already paid for the two straps, but they would allow me to work out in a more ideal place in my house. Also, the only exercise instructions are on a large poster, and there is not really enough info to clearly see what the full movements are supposed to be. There are videos on the internet, but it's not easy to figure out which ones are which and worth watching.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Best suspension trainer out there
customer_reviews.text: I've used several suspension trainers... Including trx. Best out of the bunch. I'm a personal trainer and the way this is made, creates more opportunities for proper exercises to be performed. If the price ever comes back down to what I paid for it, on sale, I'll be getting more to train several clients at a time! Don't hesitate to buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment, definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of equipment. I use them at home and with my clients at my facility. For home workouts, exercise while traveling or at the gym it's hard to beat the JGXT for both value/build quality and the fitness/strength you can develop. The dual attachment points give you an even greater variety/challenge of things you can do. Plus the ease of getting your feet into the foot cups definitely makes for smooth transitions between upper and lower body moves. If you are looking to up the level of your total body core strength, the JGXT is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: baseballbert

customer_reviews.title: Latch will slip
customer_reviews.text: Latches stopped holding the straps after a month or so and made the product unusable. I’ve switched to TRX and have had no problems
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Strength and Conditioning coaches dream
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend's birthday. He went to college and graduated as a personal trainer. He has trained many people, from high school students to women, men and college football players. He has worked as a strength and conditioning coach for years and requested Lifeline Jungle Gym as its a great and less expensive alternative to trx. So far he loves this product and is very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: angieD

customer_reviews.title: I was more than happy to by two of these
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research, I was more than happy to by two of these. One for me and one for the hubby. At half the price than the brand you've heard of, we put them through the rigors to make sure they weren't a cheap knockoff that would have us face planting into the floor. We're bigger than the average bears so you can imagine our trepidation. So far, so good! Faces are still in tact, the straps are strong and it's all good as long as you try to forget that you're essentially putting all of your body weight on two little plastic clips.
customer_reviews.author: CoveGirl

customer_reviews.title: update
customer_reviews.text: down from 4 stars strap broke after less than one year update contacted Lifeline and got a replacement in no time at all and no problem since
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mack

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great product
customer_reviews.text: Most of the other suspension straps I've used were one piece and could not be transitioned from wide to close. The length adjustments and width adjustments of the straps are incredibly easy and fast so that you don't have much down time between exercises. Everyone that has used these has said they are going to order the same exact set including people that have other suspension straps, all of whom paid more than the asking price of these. A truly great product, I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RyanM

customer_reviews.title: Stirrup broke after only a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Just as versatile as an other suspension trainer. Fast shipping. Only problem is the stirrups do not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: gsunday

customer_reviews.title: May have just been a bad box. My trainer has one that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: The clip with teeth that secures the strap after adjusting the length is a plastic piece and moved when trying to perform an exercise. It was unsafe. Return process was easy. Thank you, Amazon and vendor for providing a credit for the return.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Clamp Broke As I Tried to Assemble It
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the package & the clamp broke the first time I pinched it between my index finger & thumb. I’m so bummmed!! I was all set to get a good workout in outside, after waiting weeks for this to arrive :(.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than competitor's and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe how types of workout straps were in the market. While it didn't make sense to spend over $100 on what seemed to be webbing, I wanted a product that was well made and that I would use in the long run. These straps are it. They are made with durable plastic, and are easy to adjust for different exercises. I liked the rigid straps instead of the ones made just of webbing for feet and upper body exercises because it seemed to be more comfortable. The video is good and there are tons of other exercises on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: AMC in WV

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered yesterday so I've not used it much. It appears to be very good quality! I'm very impressed and excited to start using it!
customer_reviews.author: G T

customer_reviews.title: Better Than the TRX I Replaced It With
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple of years ago to replace a broken, commercial TRX. The TRX wasn't even used much before one of the carabiner clips gave out. I did some research and found that buyers preferred the Jungle Gym to the TRX, and after owning it for a couple of years, I agree. It still looks and works like nearly new.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product -- easy to install; easy-to-hard workout ranges; quality construction and looks good at my home gym too. However, they do not anymore provide workout DVDs with the box. I called Lifeline customer support and was told instructional DVDs were discontinued. Youtube videos are good and they even have more workouts than in DVD. It's just that I have an old TV/DVD combo at my workout place where a DVD would be very useful to watch during exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Nilendu Misra

customer_reviews.title: Preferred over TRX
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this suspension system for years. Very versatile with seemingly endless applications. I prefer the 'Jungle Gym' over the TRX system due to the independent anchor points of each strap which gives you much more variety of use. I also love the quick-change clasps to vary the height of the straps during your workout without wasting time between sets/exercises.
customer_reviews.author: C. Conley

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product!!! Many ways to use it! Sturdy and Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with product and workout
customer_reviews.text: If there is any negative to be found in purchasing this, it can only be the meager poster/guide included in the package. Otherwise, amazing build quality and very helpful starter video. I assume ever review in here discusses the virtues of YouTube, so use it. Only a BAZILLION videos for every level of workout regimen. However, take care to make certain your form is correct. Injuries are frequent for over achievers and those w/o core strength. So, be careful and go gradual, you'll love it! Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: USERBOSCO

customer_reviews.title: Lifeline USA Jungle Gym XT
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use, comfortable on hands and feet. I attached my jungle gym to the chin up bar on my power rack. I like the ridged stirups. This is a nice feature if you work out alone. It is much easier to get your feet in an out of the stirups. I think it would be near impossible to do this with regular loose strapping. The hand grips are also very comfortable. Changing strap lengths is a snap. This is a well thought out product. I would recommend the Jungle Gym to anyone who wants to add a new reasonally priced element to their workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I used to hang them from a doorway, but now I have moved somewhere with less than stellar doors, so now I hang them from a door frame pull up bar and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Camden Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great for dips and body weight rows!
customer_reviews.text: I love these for body weight Dips and rows. I attach them to my pullup bar, the simple door frame kind works but be careful, and I do backpack weighted dips and body weight rows with them. I do a lot of hiking and when hiking on large rocks you will find your self doing a lot of body weight dips. These help strengthen those muscles while working your core stabilizers at the same time. Just be sure to start small and light so you don't hurt your self. There are many more exercises you can do but the ones above are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: After using the TRX and ZIP-60 I selected this product based on other reviews. Although not as portable as the TRX (and less than half the price) I think this is better for someone using this at home. My only con is that on one of the straps the "strap end adjusters" (part E) was too loose to prevent the slack from getting in the way of an optimal workout. By sticking a small piece of cardboard into the loose strap adjustor the problem was resolved. If not for that problem I would have rated this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Having tried both Rip:60 and the TRX systems, I would say this is by far the better quality product. The cradles make it so easy to get your feet in and out, the bucklers are sturdy yet lightweight and unobtrusive, and I love being able to adjust the width for variety in my workouts! The only disadvantage is the accompanying training materials. In fact, I have held on to my Rip:60 stuff just so I can do their videos instead (with some modifications, of course, due to the inability to rotate). If you are familiar already with suspension training, this is the product to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Brother Ben

customer_reviews.title: they're much more comfortable with your feet in them
customer_reviews.text: Took the husband a while to take it out of the box but he loves to take it to the park for workouts. I use it inside looped over the door or the pull up bar. It's not a complete system, some kind of permanent mount would definitely make it more versatile. I prefer the handles to the TRX trainers at various gyms I've been to, they're much more comfortable with your feet in them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa EL

customer_reviews.title: Much better than TRX
customer_reviews.text: The hard rubber makes it easier to slip your feet in.
customer_reviews.author: Canes

customer_reviews.title: I easily prefer these over the name brand TRX
customer_reviews.text: I easily prefer these over the name brand TRX. I use them daily to train my fitness clients. I take them to the track and secure them to any secure horizontal pole with ease or put them over most any door. I love that they're separate from one another and easy to use. Very good quality as well
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMayFit

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and ergonomic construction. The guys who designed this made it much nicer than the initial iteration, and more functional. You can take it almost anywhere. Still haven't watched the video, but the basic movements on the provided poster are enough to get you started. The body weight exercises that I can do with this item are a great supplement to my daily runs to keep me strong and lean...and because I can change positions to increase difficulty it's totally adjustable without having to own a full set of weights.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra D. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than TRX and more versatile, I know because I have both. I couldn't pass up buying this Jungle Gym XT when I saw the price so I could compare my TRX to it. Construction of this product is great and will hold up to many years of use. I also like the design of the foot / hand cradles better than on the TRX; easier to use since they have wider openings and they can be cleaned!
customer_reviews.author: G man

customer_reviews.title: Low impact, great for core and mobility, you don't need a lot more to get results.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I used them with my trainer and it's amazing how much you can do with it. You can pretty much have this, a jump rope and some barbells/kettle bells and not need another piece of workout gear to hit all of your muscle groups. I train in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and this is the kind of thing that can help with core strength, mobility, flexibility and cardio if you integrate it into a workout routine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Lampi

customer_reviews.title: The best suspension handles you can buy for so many different reasons.
customer_reviews.text: These are multitudes better than it's "yellow colored competitor" and not even half the price. The adjustable width makes these far more user friendly. Excellent for dips, archer rows/archer push ups, or wide setting pushups that keep the tension on at the top of the rep. The foot saddle is incredible as well. I have been using these daily for well over a year with zero problems. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Jungle Gym is an absolutely incredible addition to my home gym. I installed a 5foot pull up bar to the joists through my ceiling just for the Jungle Gym and it works perfect. Lots of options with a width of 5feet to adjust the straps. Way more versatile than the TRX because of the individual straps. While a functional training machine would be ideal, this is a really inexpensive step towards that. Makes for a lot more options when it comes to functional training. It's hard to find an exercise with the Jungle Gym that you don't use your core to some degree. HIGHLY RECOMMED this to beginner and experienced fitness seekers alike.
customer_reviews.author: M Hendy

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have it
customer_reviews.text: I gave some thought about making my own suspension straps using the advice on some Youtube videos. After watching them, I decided that it would be much better to have a product that was professionally made. The TRX kits just seemed too expensive for someone that is exploring this type of exercise style. I read several reviews and chose the Lifeline Jungle Gym from others that were available. I am very happy with the quality of the product and enjoy having this new type of equipment in my quest to keep exercise interesting and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: xrsizfan

customer_reviews.title: Much more fun that I thought
customer_reviews.text: Suspension training was something that intrigued me mainly because it gave me the capability to do things at an angle that takes some of the strain off straight bodyweight work. Like pull-ups, push-ups, squats, etc. These are way more fun to work out with than I gave them credit for and way more intriguing for core work. Some exercises, where your feet are suspended are harder than non-suspension training because your little core muscles have to do more work to balance and hold the line you want. This is great for your workouts but weird to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Muddster

customer_reviews.title: it works great
customer_reviews.text: actually its my moms she sits in a chair and has the 2 pullys over a door then she pulls herself up its to strengthen her legs cause she just had a new hip put in I know its helped her a lot thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I love this new toy. I was going back and forth between all the different suspension trainers. I am very happy about buying this one. I really have no comparison except what the internet says about the differences. BUT I know I love this one and it works exactly how it should. Sure, I could have made one from stuff I can find at Walmart or even the dollar store like a video I saw. But this has been tested and has stood the test of other athletes using it. All in all I love it. You will too.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: great product , far better then trx
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an awesome product, the fact that both straps are separate and dont use a single anchor point like the trx makes this far superior. also the hands grips and ankle supports are much better. loving this system. the only gripe I have is the collar that take up the extra slack stretches out fast. for me it was only two days before it was pretty much useless and removed it letting the extra slack just hang. no big deal. it just looked much neater with the collar for those 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE them!!! Hung them over a door and got to work. Super easy to adjust, appreciate the video and cheat sheet that came with them. They've expanded my workouts, making them much more challenging - just what I was looking for. Plus the stretching....ahhhh, how it hurts so good. ;) Quality seems solid; I've only had them a couple of months and use appx 4 times a week. Also - Great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Madi M

customer_reviews.title: As good as the TRX but half the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an alternate to the TRX version. They are just as good as the TRX version, at half the price. I found that the strap material on the TRX version is some what abrasive to my skin when doing chest exercises.The material used on the Jungle Gym XT is some what less abrasive or irritating
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this in July 2015 and the handles start ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July 2015 and the handles start to crack December 2017; no customer service response after couple emails.
customer_reviews.author: Pin-Tsun

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Well Made, Good Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: New work-out device for me so still learning how to effectively use. However, based on my usage so far, this appears to be very well made and presents a far better value than other products on the market that seem to be nearly identical. I personally like the black and red color combination. I recommend to anyone considering suspension type exercises.
customer_reviews.author: DougR

customer_reviews.title: worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: my package got delayed twice for 2 different reasons. i am totally in love with my decision. it is very easy to use and adjusting and setup are super quick. my only bummer is my apartment only has 1 door that opens away from and and it leave BARELY enough room to work out and doesnt lock(and even if it did lock it would lock from the inside which opens towards me) cant wait to test it on some outside handle bars
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great workout, great DVD!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have used another suspension product in the past, and although I was fairly happy with it, I ordered this product because it seemed to offer more flexiblity and comfort in its use. I find it to be sturdy and well built. I also like that the length of the straps can be infinitely varied (the item I had used previously only had 4 variations on length). Additionally, the DVD was excellent, and the trainer gives a great introduction to many different types of exercises. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: E. Carbone

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - easy set up for at home use!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been taking TRX classes at a local gym and wanted a set up for the house. After A bit of research we found the Jungle Gym and decided to purchase it. We opened the box and set it up using one of the our spare bedroom doorways, I was a bit skeptical that it would be unstable, but it is great! We are loving it, the Jungle Gym makes getting a great workout at home so easy. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: After getting my trainer from the X competitor & finding the videos as advertised were not included as stated & on their box ,packing slip etc. on calling the X people I was informed if I wanted a CD I would have to burn my it my self. I returned it & ordered the Jungle Gym @ 1/2 the price. My wife who is a seasoned X user @ the gym stated this product is far superior, with their CD it will save me time on getting started Also with Amazon Prime it arrived in 2 days not 7, once again Amazon exceeds our expectations
customer_reviews.author: tk

customer_reviews.title: I try!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but I also struggle with it a little. It's an additional route to exercise, but you need to do some research on the internet to find the routines that will work for you. I tinker with it occasionally, but not as much as I expected to. I think the quality is fine, but all of the Jungle Gym's are a little over-priced. I would recommend it to a friend if they were serious about this exercise approach.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Durable, versatile at home equipment
customer_reviews.text: Since quarantine started I have been borrowing my personal trainers set of these bands. They are sturdy and hold up to regular workouts every week. I've finally purchased my own set and they came in a timely fashion and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Skip the gym, buy this to fight the dad-bod
customer_reviews.text: Entering into my "dad bod" phase of life, I bought this to work out in tandem with taking my dog for runs. So far, it's excellent. I love the split anchor system and it's really well built.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: bought this item because I personal train, and suspension training is an important aspect of getting fit. I like this better than a trx since the handle can be spaced narrow, middle(neutral) or wide. Its also great to get an awesome workout when you dont have access to a gym (like vacation), its light weight and easy to pack. the drawback ( at least that I have found is sometimes the adjustment can slip a little at certain angles...otherwise I would give this a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: S. stewart

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a personal trainer and have used a myriad of suspension trainers. This is hands down the best I have used. Extremely well made, and maximum attention to important details. Strong, super versatile, and quick and simple to adjust. Jungle Gym XT has by far the best foot stirrup set up of any, deluxe grip and very comfortable handles also. Double strap models are definitely superior.This one is the best.Plus very light to travel with. This probably sounds like an infomercial, but it isn't, I love them and highly recommend them to anyone. Price was awesome as was postage to Australia and customer service.Stoked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Substantial product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Well made. Very adaptable for differen set ups. I think this is the exact product I use at the gym where I work out. I did a lot of research, and the adjustability and quality of this product is perfect. Got it at a great price on a lightnig deal so I am glad I had done my reasearch ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: JMedrud

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I work away from home a lot, so having some equipment to use in hotel rooms if they don't have a gym, or I can't fit it in because of time constraints, is pretty important to me. A friend recommended the TRX, I had a look at it, and it's not much for the money. To my mind, this is better built and just as good for a much better price. It is very sturdy, the handles are easy to clean and it gives a very hard workout if you take the time to teach yourself some of the options it can do for you.
customer_reviews.author: ParadigmShifted

customer_reviews.title: Well-Designed For Flexibility Of Use
customer_reviews.text: I used TRX while in physical therapy and loved it but chose the Jungle Gym XT for price and anchor point flexibility. Being able to use V-pull (center-point anchoring), straight-pull or wide-pull by moving the straps apart is a perfect match to my strength and core development needs. That being said, Pivotal 5 (owner of Lifeline) loses a star for no longer providing a downloadable training video for mobile devices despite this feature listed in all their advertising. I spoke with Mark Hanner at Pivotal 5 about this, a DVD was sent, and he said he is pursuing the issue and will get back to me — hopefully with a link to the downloadable video!
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM OCONNOR

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Functional - Better Than TRX and Cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. As good or better than TRX at a much lower price. Strap quality and rubber handles are great. I have no concerns about this product. Why is it better? Because the attachments are separate and not yoked together at the center. That means you can get gymnastics ring functionality from these. I've had no problems with the straps, and use these often.
customer_reviews.author: Prosumer21

customer_reviews.title: One happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Rating this a 4.5 because I am not sure of can give it a 5. Either way it has been a few days since it's arrival and I am a very happy customer. So much so that I referred it to many people on my campus gym. Kinda like a show and tell. I let people use and get a feel for it. Many of them having never considered suspension training enjoyed the product. Do recommend for those with a moderate level of fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed with the Jungle Gym XT. I have gotten more of a workout than I thought would have been possible. The exercises have made me work my entire body like crazy. I would recommend it to anyone who is serious about getting in shape, or staying in shape. I mix the use of the Jungle Gym XT with other metabolic resistance exercises, and I have gotten fantastic results. Of course I have a healthy diet too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the bar bells.  Body weight is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: Durable quality product and easy to take in a suitcase on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Spanier

customer_reviews.title: Better than TRX
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the Jungle Jim is equal to or better than that of TRX and the design is much better. The foot stirrups are MUCH easier to get into when doing leg work. The use of over molded rubber makes the Jungle Gym more comfortable to grab, and the independence of the right and left sides allows for more adjustment during shoulder work. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Best suspension system for 2 reasons.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Adjusts easily, which is a key point when trying to make quick transitions between exercises. Also, handles stay in place without slipping. 2. Foot holds are actually comfortable and make it easier to perform exercises that require your toe or heal in the stirrup.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Kuhl

customer_reviews.title: Love these! First used these at a gym I ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! First used these at a gym I went to for a little while. Like the fact that they are completely separate from one another, seems to give more versitility and focus. Easy to use and durable, the hand grips are great and as comfortable as possible. I have large hands and have zero comfort issues. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my Jungle Gym
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated a long time between this and the TRX. Finally went with this for the flexibility of having separated straps. Oh and the price was like half. I am completely happy with it, as I have been with all the Lifeline products I have bought. Very reputable company, and this product is rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark52

customer_reviews.title: More flexible than TRX
customer_reviews.text: I caught the suspension training bug from TRX, but couldn't afford continued classes or my own personal rig. I found the Lifeline XT Jungle Gym on Amazon. The price was right so I gave it a shot. I love the flexibility of narrow (likeTRX), parallel, or wide mount to work all the major/minor muscle groups. The handles and foot slings are also an improvement from TRX. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: We've used TRX, but would buy these again if they were both priced the same.
customer_reviews.text: I like the construction of the Jungle Gym straps and grips, especially the foot cradles. TRX is nice and all, but these are priced well and constructed very well. They might not pack down quite as small as TRX due to the rigid foot cradle, but if there's much difference, it's fairly minimal. I highly recommend these if you're comfortable using a TRX type suspension system but don't want to fork out the dough for the brand name.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Singley

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to home equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to your hope equipment for days when you cannot make it to the gym. You can do countless exercises with these things. I have seen these in commercial gyms for use as well, but I bought them for home use. They are sturdy and pack up small so you could totally bring them when traveling for easy hotel room exercise!
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: You can get a great total body workout with the Lifeline Jungle Gym XT. Users can start out with beginners workout. And as you get stronger can increase the intensity of the workout by adjusting body angle and strap length.
customer_reviews.author: NOLAClaire

customer_reviews.title: Great home use!
customer_reviews.text: I've used both both the major brands at my gym. I like the versatility of these better. They are not linked in a "Y". They are independent. Love that. Gave it 4 stars for its one small weakness, you have to eyeball any height adjustments. Switching between exercises only take seconds, but having marks would help
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It does everything the TRX can do. The fact that you have two separate slings really makes a difference. Not all exercises would feel as natural doing if the two slings always came together at a single point. I think however, they need to have a more comprehensive poster. Yeah...there's a video. But having a quick reference is good to have.
customer_reviews.author: N8.T.

customer_reviews.title: Scratches your arms
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design with the metal clips that allow you to adjust the length of each side. They dig into your arms when trying to do any chest exercises. It hurts and is very uncomfortable. I am returning this after just 2 exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Second set!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I've purchased b/c the first set was so great and versatile. The quality of construction is also apparent and adjusting the straps is very simple. There are quite a few more and less expensive suspension trainers on the market; however, I am extremely pleased with these and would purchase them again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: The grips are better, the spacing is better
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used a TRX for many years, this piece of equipment blows the TRX away!!!! The grips are better, the spacing is better, the straps don't rub on my neck when I do elevated or normal push ups. I use it for body weight conditioning and training multiple times a week. Favorite exercises on it elevated push ups and inverted rows! I Great piece of training equipment, if you have a limited budget and can only get one suspension trainer, BUY THIS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews for different body weight suspension systems, I decided to I bought this one because it's price was lower than TRX. I wasn't disappointed. The material feels durable. An advantage I found is that it's easier to find where to use it in the hotel when I'm traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Its good except the handles flex and don't roll the way they're designed to. Also the strap ends that are meant to keep the slack off the ground don't work the way they're designed to either and they just slide around on the strap and do almost nothing
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Being a fitness trainer, I have put these thought the test, numerous times. I my self use them , Al I can say is great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Great way to work out with little cost and little footprint in your home. It gives me a great workout to keep me toned. Sure, if I wanted a cut body, it might be hard with this. But to keep yourself toned, it is hard to find something better. You can even take it with you when you travel. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: M. Meehan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far it's holding up to my 250lb weight like a champ. Take extra consideration on if you have a door opening the right way to mount this. I goofed and had to attach it to my chin up bar. Durability looks high, but there is some very minor scuffing showing on the handles. Adjustment is easy and the DVD is quite useful.
customer_reviews.author: B. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for something similar to a TRX. This is it. Very similar.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable Buckle No Longer Holds Tension
customer_reviews.text: One of our buckles no longer holds the tension so we can only use one of them. No place to contact the seller to ask for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa (Walsh) Hohenberger

customer_reviews.title: Gym in a suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Listen if you travel, this is a must! A well made product that I think of as a cross between gymnastic rings and TRX. They are singles like gymnastics rings but have foot stirrups and handles like TRX. Being two single straps means you can do dips on them and they adjust WAY easier and faster than either gymnastic rings (power rings) or TRX. And they hang on doorways or bars really easy and FAST. By far one of the better products that I own.
customer_reviews.author: Team Oj

customer_reviews.title: Best Susp Trainer
customer_reviews.text: My favorite suspension trainer because you can do individual arm/leg movements, and handles don't slide even with big weight on them. Only thing I don't like is that for someone OCD like myself, it takes a second to get the length even on both sides because there are no markings/measurements to show that each handle is at even length.
customer_reviews.author: hendog

customer_reviews.title: Great suspension trainer
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lifeline USA XT jungle gym and trx. They are both very good. The prices are tremendously different this life line jungle gym is one fourth the price of trx. It's well worth the money. Also with lifeline USA xt jungle gym there is a lot less rubbing of your skin so there's less bruising. TRX looks better. TRX is also easier for traveling. But Jungle gym is not that difficult for traveling. Overall of course I recommend jungle gym over TRX.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spent a fortune elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This is a really sturdy product and a great price. Also got the bands very quickly. Good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: tedzilla

product_meta.title: Lifeline Jungle Gym Suspension Trainer
feature_bullets: Take your suspension training to the next level with the Jungle Gym XT. This lightweight resistance training alternative to weights and bands is easily portable for travel and extremely versatile so you can train anywhere indoors or out.
Patented split anchor design allows for narrow, neutral and wide angles of resistance for up to 3X the exercises to target more muscle groups than single anchor versions and increase body control.

Industrial-strength suspension straps are built for punishing commercial use and the adjustable inline buckles allow for rapid strap length adjustment to quickly change between high and low exercises.
One large, full color workout wall chart and downloadable instruction video included to provide killer workouts great for users of all heights and fitness levels.
